docs.lead_paragraph: Teenage girls who are obese may be much more likely to need hip replacement later in life, researchers are reporting. The researchers, from Brigham and Women's Hospital, a Harvard teaching affiliate, found that highly overweight 18-year-olds were five times as likely as young women of normal weight to need the surgery.

headline.main: When Weight Wears Out the Hips

docs.abstract: Researchers find that teenage girls who are obese may be much more likely to need hip replacement later in life; drawing (S)
